thread.title: Portland State makes it official, names Bruce Barnum as head football coach
thread.title_full: Portland State makes it official, names Bruce Barnum as head football coach | OregonLive.com

author: Ken Goe | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland State makes it official, names Bruce Barnum as head football coach
text:
Bruce Barnum, who has guided Portland State to a 4-1 record and the No. 17 ranking on the FCS level as interim football coach, was given the job outright on Wednesday.
Details are expected to be announced today. Barnum is expected to be given a five-year deal.
The Vikings have beaten two FBS teams on the road this season.
They knocked off Washington State 24-17, and last week hammered North Texas 66-7.
Barnum was offensive coordinator when he was promoted to succeed the fired Nigel Burton on an interim basis at the end of last season.
The Vikings were 3-9 in 2014.
Barnum has rallied the team around a hard-nosed, blue-collar style of football the Vikings have dubbed "BarnyBall."
PSU is believed to have followed state law in hiring Barnum as coach, and interviewed at least one qualified minority candidate.
The Vikings meet Montana State (3-2) in a key Big Sky Conference game at 12:30 p.m. Saturday in Providence Park.
-- Ken Goe
kgoe@oregonian.com
503-221-8040 | @KenGoe
